body:
I've compiled the shared lib in debug mode and re-run valgrind with it. Here are the main findings:

```
==1845961== 25,165,824 bytes in 2 blocks are still reachable in loss record 17,683 of 17,684

==1845961==    by 0x5218E7B: onnxruntime::utils::DefaultAlloc(unsigned long) (utils.cc:86)

==1845961==    by 0x514A503: onnxruntime::BFCArena::AllocateRawInternal(unsigned long, bool) (bfc_arena.cc:310)
==1845961==    by 0x5149CD3: onnxruntime::BFCArena::Alloc(unsigned long) (bfc_arena.cc:247)
```

Disable the arena and try it again. There is a session option to control it.
@yihonglyu Could you please help take a look? It seems you are the last author of SetupUpsampleBilinear.
@snnn Disabling the arena seems to have helped quite a bit.
@ayeganov  Can you tell me how to disable the arena? Thank you!
hi @snnn , could you explain why to disable the arena? What is the root cause of the Memory Leak when running CPU model in C++. Thanks
